IRS990.MissionDescription: As the industry's trusted knowledge leader, the institutes are committed to meeting the evolving educational needs of the risk management and insurance community. We prepare people to fultill their professional and ethical responsibilities by offering customer-focused and innovative educational solutions.
IRS990.Description: EDUCATIONAL-RELATED EXPENSES-EXAMINATIONS, EDUCATIONAL MATERIAL SOLD & CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: The organization accrues pay for performance expense and the amounts get determined mostly based on the performance reviews RELATED TO MEETING OF CERTAIN GOALS OF INSURANCE INSTITUTE OF AMERICA And A RELATED ORGANIZATION(WHICH INCLUDE OVERALL REVENUE).

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY A THIRD-PARTY ACCOUNTING FIRM AND REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT. THE FORM 990 WAS PROVIDED TO THE AUDIT AND ORGANIZATION AND COMPENSATION COMMITTEES OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES BEFORE IT WAS FILED.
ANNUAL FORM SUBMITTED BY ALL TRUSTEES AND REVIEWED BY CORPORATE SECRETARY FOR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S CEO, OFFICERS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE COMPENSATED BY A RELATED ORGANIZATION, WHICH UTILIZES A REVIEW AND APPROVAL BY INDEPENDENT PERSONS, COMPARABILITY DATA, AND CONTEMPORANEOUS SUBSTANTIATION OF THE DECISION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICTS OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON WRITTEN REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART IV, LINE I2 AND PART XI, LINE 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AUDITED ON A CONSOLIDATED BASIS WITH A RELATED TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION. THE AUDIT IS ALSO REVIEWED BY AN AUDIT COMMITTEE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: OTHER SALARIES&WAGES, PENSION PLAN CONTRIBUTIONS & OTHER EMPLOYEE BENEFITS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OTHER SALARIES AND WAGES REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART IX, LINE 7, PENSION PLAN CONTRIBUTIONS REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART IX, LINE 8, AND OTHER EMPLOYEE BENEFITS REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART IX, LINE 9 REPRESENT ALLOCATIONS OF SALARIES, WAGES, PENSION PLAN CONTRIBUTIONS, AND EMPLOYEE BENEFITS PAID BY AN AFFILIATE, DUE TO CENTRALIZED PAYROLL PROCESSING OR CENTRALIZED EMPLOYMENT. NO FORM 941 WAS FILED FOR THIS ENTITY; THEREFORE, FORM 990, PART V, LINE 2A SHOWS "0" FOR THE NUMBER OF EMPLOYEES REPORTED ON FORM W-3 FORM 941 REPORTING IS FILED UNDER THE FOLLOWING AFFILIATE: AMERICAN INSTITUTE FOR CPCU (EIN:23-1352012). INSTITUTE FOR CPCU (EIN:23-1352012).

DEPRECIATION EXPENSE REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART IX, LINE 22 REPRESENTS AN ALLOCATION OF DEPRECIATION EXPENSE FROM AN AFFILIATE, AMERICAN INSTITUTE FOR CPCU (EIN:23-1352012), BASED UPON INSURANCE INSTITUTE OF AMERICA'S PRO-RATA USE OF THE AFFILIATE'S FIXED ASSETS. FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2008, $684,654 IN DEPRECIATION EXPENSE WAS ALLOCATED TO INSURANCE INSTITUTE OF AMERICA.

CONTRIBUTIONS REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 1F REPRESENT AN ALLOCATION OF CONTRIBUTIONS FROM AN AFFILIATE, AMERICAN INSTITUTE FORCPCU (EIN:23-1352012), BASED UPON COMBINED FUNRAISING EFFORTS. FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2008, $541,531 IN CONTRIBUTIONS WERE ALLOCATED TO INSURANCE INSTITUTE OF AMERICA. -------------------------------------------------------------------------- INTEREST AND DIVIDEND INCOME REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART I, LINE 5 REPRESENTS AN ALLOCATION OF INTEREST AND DIVIDEND INCOME FROM AN AFFILIATE, AMERICAN INSTITUTE FOR CPCU (EIN:23-1352012), BASED UPON INSURANCE INSTITUTE OF AMERICA'S PRO-RATA OWNERSHIP OF THE AFFILIATE'S INVESTMENTS. FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2008, $1,474,114 IN INTEREST AND DIVIDEND INCOME WAS ALLOCATED TO INSURANCE INSTITUTE OF AMERICA. ------------------------------------------------------------------------- REALIZED GAIN ON SALE OF INVESTMENTS REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 7 REPRESENTS AN ALLOCATION OF REALIZED GAIN FROM AN AFFILIATE, AMERICAN INSTITUTE FOR CPCU (EIN:23-1352012), BASED UPON INSURANCE INSTITUTE OF AMERICA'S PRO-RATA OWNERSHIP OF THE AFFILIATE'S INVESTMENTS. FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2008, $1,285,853 IN REALIZED GAIN WAS ALLOCATED TO INSURANCE INSTITUTE OF AMERICA.
INSURANCE INSTITUTE OF AMERICA HAS ENTERED INTO A MANAGEMENT AND ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES AGREEMENT WITH A RELATED, TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION.

THE IIA BYLAWS HAVE BEEN RESTATED TO BRING THEM UP-TO-DATE AND CONSISTENT WITH RELEVANT FEDERAL AND STATE NOT-FOR-PROFIT LAWS. BECAUSE IIA IS A NEW YORK CORPORATION WHICH DOES NOT ALLOW FOR A LIFE TRUSTEE CLASS, THIS CLASS OF TRUSTEE HAS BEEN ELIMINATED FROM THE IIA BYLAWS.
The organization is filing an amended return to amend the following parts or schedules: - Form 990, Part VI, Line 20 - Form 990, Part VII, Section A - Schedule J, Part II
